text: The man who makes no mistakes does not usually make anything.
source: Phelps, inspired by Ancient Greek wisdom

text: Better to do a little well, than a great deal badly.
The secret of change is to focus all of your energy, not on fighting the old, but on building the new.
To avoid criticism say nothing, do nothing, be nothing.
There are two kinds of people in the world: those who divide people into two groups, and those who don't.
If you're going through hell, keep going. The exit isn't behind you.
Doubt is the beginning of wisdom. Certainty is the beginning of folly.
The wise person possesses humility. They know what they do not know.
A society grows great when old men plant trees in whose shade they know they shall never sit. Politicians cut them down for short-term gain.
The greatest wealth is health. The second greatest is having someone who reminds you to eat your vegetables.
You cannot step into the same river twice, for other waters are continually flowing in. But you can fall into the same mistake repeatedly.
The highest form of human excellence is to question oneself and others.
Courage is the first of human qualities because it is the quality which guarantees all others.
The greatest wealth is to live content with little.
The good of man is the active exercise of his soul's faculties in conformity with excellence or virtue.
